topic.title: DITA XML Editing, Collaboration and Publishing Overview
topic.shortdesc: This is an overview of the possibilities Oxygen XML offers to edit DITA XML content, reuse, profile, review and and publish to various output formats like WebHelp Responsive and CSS-based PDF.

section.title: Overview
section.p: An overview of the application's DITA XML editing support can be found here: . Some of the strong points:

ul.li: Complete DITA XML editing, review and publishing support.

section.p: Some frequently asked questions about the overall solution, which companies can benefit from using it and how the solution is usually purchased can be found here: .

section.title: DITA Maps Manager
section.p:
The DITA Maps Manager view allows editing, validating, making project-wide changes and publishing.
Create new topics and refer to them either one by one or by using the Fast Create Topics action.
Project- wide Operations:
Search references.
Rename, move or delete existing topic references.
Validate and Check for Completeness.
Map-wide XML refactoring actions.
Find/Replace in Files.
Spell Check in Files.
Past webinars recording covering DITA XML editing with Oxygen: .

section.title: Topic Editing
section.p:
Full support to edit DITA XML Topics. Some highlights:
Change Tags Visualisation Mode.
CSS Styles drop down.
Content Completion Window.
Helper side views (Outline, Attributes, Elements views, DITA Reusable Components).
Menu/Contextual Menu and Toolbar with DITA specific actions:
Insert links.
Content Reuse.
Edit Profiling Attributes.
Work with tables.
Insert references image and media resources.
Insert lists, paragraph, bold/italic/underline styling.
Multiple ways to insert links and content references using copy/paste, drag and drop.
Past webinars recording covering DITA XML editing with Oxygen: .

section.title: Content Reuse
section.p:
The DITA XML standard has lots of content reuse capabilities. Oxygen allows you to utilize the full potential of the DITA 1.3 standard:
Reuse product names using key definitions with keywords.
Reuse XML elements in multiple places.
Reuse ranges of XML elements.
Push reusable content in target topics.
Reuse entire DITA XML topics in multiple parts of the DITA Map.
Use DITA 1.3 key scopes to reuse topics with variable content in various contexts.

UI capabilities to insert reusable content:
DITA Maps Manager -> Insert Key Definition with Keyword.
DITA XML topic editing toolbar with possibilities to Reuse Content.
Using special paste to paste content references in topics.
The DITA Reusable Components side view.
Content Completion actions to insert reusable content (keyrefs and conrefs).
Past webinars recording covering DITA XML content reuse with Oxygen: .

section.title: Profiling/Filters
section.p: Profiling capabilities allow generating multiple similar user manuals from the same DITA XML content.

With Oxygen you can:
Define values for the DITA profiling attributes and they can be easily managed to filter content in the published output.
Switch between profile sets to see how the edited content looks like before publishing.
Past webinars recording covering DITA XML profiling with Oxygen: .

ul.li:
The Main Files support in the Oxygen Project view allows powerful refactoring operations:
Move or rename either one or multiple files.
Change directory names or move entire directories.
Apply XML refactoring actions on multiple files or entire folders.

The Validate and Check For Completeness tool available in the DITA Maps Manager view performs dozens of useful validation checks starting from a DITA map or from a DITA Open Toolkit project:
Validate each map and topic according to the standard schemas.
Validate each map and topic with a custom set Schematron schema.
Check for broken links.
Check for profiling/filter problems.
and so much more....
Schematron checks with quick fixes can be added to report structural problems.
The integrated spell checker and the Terminology Checker add-on can be used to check for content-related problems.
You can use the smart paste support to convert MS Word or Web content to DITA XML content on paste.
Or you can use the Oxygen Batch Documents Converter add-on to migrate various document formats to DITA XML.
Dynamic on the fly conversions are also available for Markdown, OpenAPI or Word documents referenced directly in a DITA Map.

section.title: Framework Customizations
section.p:
Customize the overall DITA XML editing functionality by:
Adding new actions in the DITA specific menus and toolbars.
Remove existing actions.
Customize the content completion window to add or remove entries.
Customize the visual editing using your custom CSS.
Use your own new file templates.
Add custom validation stages using custom schemas or Schematron checks.
and much more...

section.title: Useful Add-ons
section.p:
The Oxygen default add-ons repository offers a variety of useful add-ons among which the following can be mentioned:
Git Client add-on - Connect to Git repositories.
Content Fusion connector - Allow SMEs to review technical documentation content directly in a web broser.
Batch Documents Converter - Convert from various formats like MS Word, DocBook, Markdown, XHTML to DITA XML.
Terminology Checker - Check for terminology related problems.
Fluenta DITA Translation Add-on - Use the Fluenta third party library to create XLiff exports from DITA Maps and to import DITA Maps from translated XLiff files.
Oxygen AI Positron Assistant.

section.title: Review
section.p:
People can give feedback on the written technical documentation in various ways:
Internal review directly in the Oxygen desktop application:
Use change tracking to make changes to existing content or to accept/reject changes.
Use the comments support to add comments, reply to comments or resolve them.
Internal review content using the Content Fusion platform.
Internal or external review by publishing to WebHelp Responsive output and using the Feedback platform.

section.title: Translate
section.p:
Oxygen has support to:
Export from the DITA Maps Manager view a DITA Map as a zip in order to provide it to a translation agency.
Fluenta DITA Translation Add-on - Use the Fluenta third party library to create XLiff exports from DITA Maps and to import DITA Maps from translated XLiff files.

section.title: Publishing
section.p: Oxygen's bundled Oxygen Publishing Engine based on the DITA Open Toolkit open source project allows publishing DITA XML content to various outputs like WebHelp Responsive, PDF (CSS customization based), PDF (XSL-FO customization based), MS Word, EPUB, Windows Help, Markdown and other.

The WebHelp Responsive and PDF (CSS customization based) outputs can be customized by creating publishing templates:
By using the Oxygen Styles Basket Web Site.
By using the user's guide articles and samples to customise the CSSs: .
